subject: Golf
lead_paragraph: The second-year L.P.G.A. player Ji Young Oh won her first tournament, sinking a 6-inch putt for par to win the State Farm Classic in a playoff over the rookie Yani Tseng in Springfield, Ill. A day after the tournament lost its marquee player, Michelle Wie, to disqualification, the sudden-death playoff injected life into what had been an ordinary final round. Tseng, the third-round leader, chipped her third shot over the green and into the rough, then pitched to about 6 feet from the cup. But Oh’s third shot, from just inside the rough, left her with the tap-in that gave her the win.
